articles.author: Jim Robbins, Thomas Fuller, Christine Chung
articles.title: Yellowstone Flooding Is a Sign of What’s to Come for National Parks - The New York Times
articles.description: Record rainfall and mudslides forced closures just as tourism season ramped up. Virtually none of America’s national parks are untouched by extreme weather and climate change.
articles.content: Millions of tourists are drawn each year to the wilderness and active geysers in Yellowstone, which sprawls across more than two million acres in the northwest corner of Wyoming and into Montana and … [+1554 chars]

articles.author: Mitch Smith
articles.title: Decades After Vincent Chin’s Death, Recent Attacks Haunt Asian Americans - The New York Times
articles.description: Vincent Chin, a Chinese immigrant, was beaten to death after being pursued by two white Detroit autoworkers in 1982. On the 40th anniversary of his death, many hear frightening echoes.
articles.content: Mr. Chin, who was 27, worked as a draftsman and part-time waiter and was about to get married. On the night he was killed, he had gone with friends to a strip club for his bachelor party. He got into… [+1492 chars]

articles.title: American, Canadian and Mexican 2026 World Cup host cities set to be announced - CNN
articles.description: Cities that have applied to host matches at the 2026 men's World Cup, the first edition to feature 48 teams and the first to be staged in three countries, will find out on Thursday whether their bids have been successful.
